title: In Articulo Mortis
segmentation: Hello good morning, my name is Daniel Dover.

It is perhaps the impossibility of her seeing what's to come that keeps us wanting to build carefully calculated and constructed images of the unknown of the possibilities, dreams and hopes of the places where the path we have built is leading us to.

But what happens when the future seems somehow gloom when the everlasting bodies of the Stoic architecture are but corpses fading into the sun or become the tragic yet fascinating spectacle of a building's obliteration from this Earth?
When we think about the future, even after the future has reached us even after death, what is left?
The project that I'll present today departs from the realization of architectures, susceptibility to death, disappearance, and oblivion.

During the brief moment between life and death and the attempts of architecture to survive in any way possible, aware of the fact that it might not do so in a physical way.

Consequence of the Central American migrations across what has been now constituted as an international border across the Mexican territory.

The projects presented here talk about the past and their relation to our present and the present as the beginning of our future.
